posts.post_content: Recently played a casual game with 6 of my friends. Had a [mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mycoloth), [Battlegrace Angle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Battlegrace Angle), [mayrael's Aria](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mayrael's Aria), and a [cradle of vitality](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cradle of vitality) out. Ended up getting near to 200 life before the game ended. Having a 44/44 mycoloth dual wielding mageslayers + near 100 saporling + [knotvine paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=knotvine paladin) has its perks even when ure Aria gets exiled. no kill like over kill.

posts.post_content:
This card can be usefull since if you can scare you opponent enought is might force him to use a ring of oblivion or a maelstrom pulse on it. and it will force him to react
  
   
But other wise it would give you a bonus at around turn 6 at the earliest in a realistic scenario.
  
   
Let say you have a deck build around using Mayael as soon as possible.
  
   
Turn 1 : Forest + Bird of paradise
  
Turn 2 : Plain + Wooly Thoctar but if your opponent is smart he will terminte, path to exile, ring of oblivion, flame javelin, 2 shock... ect your woolly thoctar. And considering that wooly thoctar is a 5/4 on turn 2 they will probably kill him a away or an other.
  
Turn 3 : Mountain + Mayael's Aria
  
   
So yeah if your lucky then maybe you could benefit at turn 4. but let's be realistic you'll need to come out with a new creature because no player a ready to fight a wooly thoctar before turn 5 so they will path to exile or terminate him or block with a 1/1 then agony warp him... and if your opponent let yo... posts.post_content: I play this in my Naya deck now with [Apocalypse Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Apocalypse Hydra) and [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth). Pretty awesome. It's not too hard to get the conditional win with [Apocalypse Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Apocalypse Hydra), especially if you are using any kind of mana acceleration. And the counters accelerate how many babies [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth) pumps out each turn and makes them beefier. I do agree with comments on how this card seems too uber, but I play with it anyway. :)
posts.html:
I play this in my Naya deck now with Apocalypse Hydra and Mycoloth. Pretty awesome. posts.post_content:
Unfortunately the other post is right, its on upkeep, an until end of turn power boosts wont trigger it. That having been said, there are several very very easy ways to make that happen, but the easiest one is apocalypse hydra, as long as its counters you add are more than 5 it doubles to 10, but it doesn't stop at 10 either. If you can pay at least enough to get 10, you can cast soul's might on it either immediately or during the next turn for a 20/20 creature. Feral hydra will also do, it can increase its own counters. On top of that, doubling season can signifigantly ramp up any creature to 20/20 in no time, your feral hydra would gain 2/2 per 3 mana, your mighty emergence would gain 4/4 instead of 2/2, and your apocalypse hydra would come into play as a 20/20.
  
   
Mayael's aria, doubling season, apocalypse hydra played with 7 mana = game win on next upkeep.
  
   
I think its a nice benefit to naya since a lot of "spikes" out there will do anything to win and this can short cut ther... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Buridan (10/31/2009 11:08:40 AM)

posts.post_content:
Until the end of turn boosters will affect this enchantment, you just need to know when to cast them. If you give your creature '+20/+20 until end of turn' during your opponents end step, it does not fade until your end step, and is thus around for your upkeep, giving you the win.   
  
So if you have this out, its a good time to tap creatures with a power of ten or greater to feed your [Mossbridge Troll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mossbridge Troll) and win.
posts.html:
Until the end of turn boosters will affect this enchantment, you just need to know when to cast them. If you give your creature '+20/+20 until end of turn' during your opponents end step, it does not fade until your end step, and is thus around for your upkeep, giving you the win.

So if you have this out, its a good time to tap creatures with a power of ten or greater to feed your Mossbridge Troll and win.

posts.post_content:
Turn 1: Birds of Paradise + Forest  
Turn 2: Mayael's Aria + Plains  
Turn 3: Ajani Goldmane  
Turn 4: doing everything possible to keep your health total at 20+ (+2 life helps)  
Turn 5: repeat turn 4 + Ajani's Avatar  
Turn 6 upkeep: win  
  
Of course, that requires a very specific starting lot, with 5 specific cards by turn 3. But it'd be a quick, fairly safe win.
